extendedIngredients.name: english cucumber
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 English cucumber, chopped into ¼-inch pieces (about 2 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: mango
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ripe mango, skinless and chopped into ½-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: salted peanuts
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup salted peanuts, crushed and toasted

extendedIngredients.name: tamari
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon soy sauce, or tamari to make this salad gluten-free

extendedIngredients.name: watermelon
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups watermelon, deseeded and cut into cubes or melon balls
metaInformation: cut into cubes or melon balls

recipes.title: Cucumber Basil and Watermelon Salad with Love and Lemons

winePairing.pairingText: Watermelon Salad can be paired with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Downton Abbey Countess of Grantham Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Downton Abbey Countess of Grantham Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Our Downton Abbey Chardonnay displays lovely aromas of tropical fruits and subtle oak on the nose, which give way to flavors of citrus and fresh-cut pineapple on a soft, silky palate. The wine's bright characters and luscious mouthfeel continue through a clean, medium finish. The beautifully balanced and food-friendly bottling is the perfect wine choice for you most regal gatherings or spontaneous get-togethers.

recipes.instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce or tamari, garlic, ginger, lime juice, and rice vinegar.Add the watermelon, cucumber, mango, serrano pepper, cilantro, and basil. Chill for 30 minutes. Drain the excess liquid before serving.Serve with the crushed peanuts on top of the salad.Reprinted with permission from The Love & Lemons Cookbook: An Apple-to-Zucchini Celebration of Impromptu Cooking

steps.step: In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce or tamari, garlic, ginger, lime juice, and rice vinegar.
Add the watermelon, cucumber, mango, serrano pepper, cilantro, and basil. Chill for 30 minutes.
Drain the excess liquid before serving.
Serve with the crushed peanuts on top of the salad.Reprinted with permission from The Love & Lemons Cookbook: An Apple-to-Zucchini Celebration of Impromptu Cooking
